sections.title: Rclone
sections.text: Index files from rclone remotes into a consolidated SQLite catalog while emitting progress updates through the standard datasource progress channel.

sections.title: Typical workflow
sections.intro: Configure Rclone with the connection fields and run it as part of a BrainBoost pipeline.

cards.title: Connect
cards.text: Provide rclone_config_path, sqlite_path, drives, dirs in the connection form.

cards.title: Fetch
cards.text: Run `fetch()` to ingest, transform, or stream data.

cards.title: Consume
cards.text: Use the emitted items in downstream indexing, search, or automation steps.

items.q: What do I need to configure?
items.a: At minimum: rclone_config_path, sqlite_path, drives, dirs. Additional fields may be optional depending on your use case.
Builds a local SQLite catalog for fast search and downstream processing.
Outputs are emitted to downstream subscribers in the BrainBoost pipeline. Some datasources also write artifacts (context files, catalogs, or exports) locally based on your configuration.
